properties.name: energy_per_nearby_scan
properties.description: The amount of energy the radar has to consume for nearby scan to be performed. Performance warning: nearby scan causes recharting of many chunks, which is expensive operation. If you want to make a radar that updates map more in real time, you should keep its range low. If you are making radar with high range, you should set this value such that nearby scan is performed once a second or so. For example if you set energy_usage to 100kW, setting energy_per_nearby_scan to 100kJ will cause nearby scan happen once per second. This value doesn't have any effect on sector scanning.

properties.name: energy_per_sector

tables.name: Loader1x1
tables.description:
Continuously loads and unloads machines, as an alternative to inserters.
This loader type is identical to Prototype/Loader1x2 with the exception of its hardcoded belt_distance:

  • The belt_distance of the loader determines the distance between the position of this loader and the tile of the loader's belt target.
  • This loader type always has a belt_distance of 0, meaning by default it is 1 tile long in total.
  • For a loader type with a belt_distance of 0.5, see Prototype/Loader1x2.

properties.name: filter_count
properties.description: How many item filters this loader has. Maximum count of filtered items in loader is 5.

properties.name: belt_length
properties.description: How long this loader's belt is. Should be the same as belt_distance, which is hardcoded to 0.5 for this loader type. Prototype/Loader1x1 can be used if a belt_distance of 0 is desired.

properties.name: container_distance
properties.description: The distance between the position of this loader and the tile of the loader's container target.

tables.name: Loader1x2
tables.description:
Continuously loads and unloads machines, as an alternative to inserters.
This loader type is identical to Prototype/Loader1x1 with the exception of its hardcoded belt_distance:

  • The belt_distance of the loader determines the distance between the position of this loader and the tile of the loader's belt target.
  • This loader type always has a belt_distance of 0.5, meaning by default it is 2 tiles long in total.
  • For a loader type with a belt_distance of 0, see Prototype/Loader1x1.

properties.name: connection_distance

properties.name: joint_distance
properties.description:
The length between this rolling stocks front and rear joints. Joints are the point where connection_distance is measured from when rolling stock are connected to one another. Wheels sprite are placed based on the joint position.

Maximum joint distance is 15.

Note: There needs to be border at least 0.2 between the bounding box edge and joint.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description:
Maximum speed of the rolling stock in tiles/tick.

In-game, the max speed of a train is min(all_rolling_stock_max_speeds) × average(all_fuel_modifiers_in_all_locomotives). This calculated train speed is then silently capped to 7386.3km/h.

properties.name: crafting_categories
properties.description: A list of recipe categories this crafting machine can use.

properties.name: crafting_speed
properties.description:
How fast this crafting machine can craft. 1 means that for example a 1 second long recipe take 1 second to craft. 0.5 means it takes 2 seconds, and 2 means it takes 0.5 seconds.

Crafting speed has to be positive.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description:
Defines how the crafting machine is powered.

When using an electric energy source and drain is not specified, it will be set to energy_usage ÷ 30 automatically.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: Sets how much energy this machine uses while crafting. Energy usage has to be positive.

properties.name: allowed_effects
properties.description: Sets the module effects that are allowed to be used on this machine.

properties.name: always_draw_idle_animation
properties.description: Only loaded if idle_animation is present.

properties.name: animation
properties.description:
The animation played when crafting. When the crafting machine is idle, the animation will be paused.

When a crafting machine cannot be rotated, only the north rotation of the animation will be used.

properties.name: base_productivity
properties.description: Productivity bonus that this machine always has.

properties.name: default_recipe_tint
properties.description: Each key/value pair is optional and defaults to the above value.

properties.name: draw_entity_info_icon_background
properties.description: Whether the "alt-mode icon" should have a black background.

properties.name: entity_info_icon_shift
properties.description: Shift of the "alt-mode icon" relative to the machine's center.

properties.name: fluid_boxes
properties.description:
Can have off_when_no_fluid_recipe key that has a bool value. off_when_no_fluid_recipe defaults to false. off_when_no_fluid_recipe is ignored by Prototype/Furnaces and considered to always be false.

If a crafting machine has fluid boxes and off_when_no_fluid_recipe is true, the crafting machine can only be rotated when a recipe consuming or producing fluid is set, or it has one of the other properties listed at the top of the page.

properties.name: idle_animation
properties.description:
Idle animation must have the same frame count as animation. It is used for drawing the machine in idle state, but the is animation frozen on a single frame when the machine is idle.

This is an animation and not just sprite to make it possible for idle state and working state to match their visuals when the machine switches from one state to another.

When a crafting machine cannot be rotated, only the north rotation of the idle animation will be used.

properties.name: match_animation_speed_to_activity
properties.description: Whether the speed of the animation and working visualization should be based on the machine's speed (boosted or slowed by modules).

properties.name: module_specification
properties.description: The number of module slots in this machine, and their icon positions.

properties.name: return_ingredients_on_change
properties.description: Controls whether the ingredients of an in-progress recipe are destroyed when mining the machine/changing the recipe. If set to true, the ingredients do not get destroyed. This affects only the ingredients of the recipe that is currently in progress, so those that visually have already been consumed while their resulting product has not yet been produced.

properties.name: scale_entity_info_icon
properties.description: Whether the "alt-mode icon" should be scaled to the size of the machine.

properties.name: shift_animation_transition_duration
properties.description: Only loaded if shift_animation_waypoints is present.

properties.name: shift_animation_waypoint_stop_duration
properties.description: Only loaded if shift_animation_waypoints is present.

properties.name: shift_animation_waypoints
properties.description: Only loaded if one of shift_animation_waypoint_stop_duration or shift_animation_transition_duration is not 0.

properties.name: show_recipe_icon
properties.description: Whether the "alt-mode icon" should be drawn at all.

properties.name: show_recipe_icon_on_map
properties.description: Whether the recipe icon should be shown on the map.

tables.name: CraftingMachine
tables.description:
The abstract basis of the assembling machines and furnaces. Contains the properties that both of them have.

Note that a crafting machine cannot be rotated unless it has at least one of the following: a fluid box, a heat energy source, a fluid energy source, or a non-square collision box. Crafting machines with non-square collision boxes can only be rotated before placement, not after.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the animation. Must be unique. Used in https://lua-api.factorio.com/latest/LuaRendering.html#LuaRendering.draw_animation.

properties.name: animation_speed
properties.description: Modifier of the animation playing speed, the default is 1, which means one animation frame per tick (60 fps). The speed of playing can often vary depending on the usage (output of steam engine for example). Has to be greater than 0.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Mandatory if stripes is not specified.

properties.name: frame_count
properties.description: Can't be 0.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description: Unused.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Height of one frame in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the Animation.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Animation definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. Each item (Animation definition) in the array may also have the layers property.

If this property is present, all other properties are ignored and the mandatory properties do not have to be defined.

Layers may not be an empty table.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description: Once the specified number of pictures is loaded, other pictures are loaded on other line. This is to allow having longer animations in matrix, to avoid pictures with too big width. The game engine limits the width of any input picture to 2048px, so it is compatible with most graphics cards.

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error (Example). If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description:
Only loaded if this is an icon (has flag "group=icon" or "group=gui").
Note: mipmap_count doesn't make sense in animation, as it is not possible to layout mipmaps in a way, that would load correctly both the animation and the mipmaps (besides animations with just one frame).[2]

properties.name: position
properties.description: Loaded only when x and y are both 0. The first member of the array is x and the second is y.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description: Whether alpha should be premultiplied.

properties.name: repeat_count
properties.description: Can't be 0.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values different than 1 specify the scale of the animation on default zoom. Scale 2 means that the picture will be 2 times bigger on screen (and more pixelated).

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The width and height of the one frame. If this is an array, the first member of the array is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height.

Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Width of one frame in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the animation in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the animation in the source file in pixels.

tables.name: Animation
tables.description: Specifies a animation that can be used by https://lua-api.factorio.com/latest/LuaRendering.html#LuaRendering.draw_animation during runtime.

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: Requires ammo_type in attack_parameters.

properties.name: corpse
properties.description: The name of an entity. Note that this overrides how EntityWithHealth loads the corpse, forcing it to be a string instead of an array of strings.

properties.name: glow_light_intensity
properties.description: The intensity of light in the form of energy_glow_animation drawn on top of energy_glow_animation.

properties.name: prepare_range
properties.description: Default: The range defined in the attack_parameters

tables.name: Turret
tables.description: A turret that needs no extra ammunition. See the extensions for turrets that need some kind of ammunition.

properties.name: entity_filter_count
properties.description: Can't be > 255.

properties.name: tile_filter_count
properties.description: Can't be > 255.

tables.name: DeconstructionItem
tables.description: A deconstruction planner.

properties.name: distribution_effectivity
properties.description: The multiplier of the module's effects, when shared between neighbors.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Must be an electric or void energy source.

properties.name: module_specification
properties.description: The number of module slots in this beacon, and their icon positions.

properties.name: supply_area_distance
properties.description: The maximum distance that this Beacon can supply it's neighbors with it's module's effects. Max distance is 64.

properties.name: allowed_effects
properties.description: The types of modules that a player can place inside of the Beacon.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: The animation for the beacon, when in use. Loaded only if graphics_set is not present.

properties.name: base_picture
properties.description: The picture of the beacon when it is not on. Loaded only if graphics_set is not present.

properties.name: graphics_set
properties.description: The graphics for the beacon.

tables.name: Beacon
tables.description: Entity with the ability to transfer module's effects to its neighboring entities.

properties.name: fluid
properties.description: The name of the fluid that is produced by the pump.

properties.name: pumping_speed
properties.description: How many units of fluid are produced per tick. Must be > 0.

properties.name: adjacent_tile_collision_mask
properties.description: Tiles colliding with adjacent_tile_collision_box must NOT collide with this collision mask.

properties.name: adjacent_tile_collision_test
properties.description: Tiles colliding with adjacent_tile_collision_box must collide with this collision mask (unless it's empty).

properties.name: center_collision_mask
properties.description: Tile at placement position must NOT collide with this collision mask.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_points
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: graphics_set
properties.description: Mandatory if picture is not defined.

properties.name: min_perceived_performance
properties.description: Animation runs at least this fast.

properties.name: picture
properties.description: Deprecated, use graphics_set instead. Ignored if graphics_set is defined.

tables.name: OffshorePump
tables.description: An offshore pump.

properties.name: charge_cooldown
properties.description: Count of ticks to preserve the animation even when the charging ends. Used to prevent rapid blinking of the accumulator with unstable need to use it.

properties.name: discharge_cooldown
properties.description: How long (in ticks) the animation will last after discharge has been initialized.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The capacity of the energy source buffer specifies the capacity of the accumulator. Must be an electric energy source.

properties.name: charge_light
properties.description: Note that some kind of charge_animation must also be defined for the light to appear.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: The pictures displayed for circuit connections to this accumulator.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_point
properties.description: Defines how wires visually connect to this accumulator.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: default_output_signal
properties.description: The name of the signal that is the default for when an accumulator is connected to the circuit network.

properties.name: discharge_light
properties.description: Note that some kind of charge_animation must also be defined for the light to appear.

tables.name: Accumulator
tables.description: Entity with energy source with specialised animation for charging/decharging.

properties.name: category
properties.description: Controls in what tab the autoplace is shown in the map generator GUI.

properties.name: richness
properties.description:
Sets whether this control's richness can be set by the player or not.

If your autoplace control is used to generate ores, you probably want this to be true.

tables.name: AutoplaceControl
tables.description: A setting in the map creation GUI. Used by the autoplace system. Only 255 instances of this prototype may be defined.

tables.name: CopyPasteTool
tables.description: A copy-paste or cut-paste tool.

properties.name: energy_consumption
properties.description: The continuous power consumption of the belt immunity equipment.

tables.name: BeltImmunityEquipment
tables.description: Used by belt immunity equipment.

properties.name: eat
properties.description: The sound file played when the character eats (fish for example).

properties.name: heartbeat
properties.description: The sound file played when the character's health is low.

properties.name: mining_with_tool_particles_animation_positions
properties.description: List of positions in the mining with tool animation when the mining sound and mining particles are created.

properties.name: running_sound_animation_positions
properties.description: List of positions in the running animation when the walking sound is played.

properties.name: character_corpse
properties.description: Name of the character corpse that is spawned when this character dies.

properties.name: crafting_categories
properties.description: Names of the crafting categories the character can craft recipes from. The built-in categories can be found here. See also Prototype/RecipeCategory.

properties.name: enter_vehicle_distance
properties.description: Must be >= 0.

properties.name: footprint_particles
properties.description: Array of footprint particles. Triggered when the running animation (#animations) rolls over the frames defined in right_footprint_frames and left_footprint_frames.

properties.name: footstep_particle_triggers
properties.description: Triggered every tick of the running animation.

properties.name: has_belt_immunity
properties.description: Whether this character is moved by belts when standing on them.

properties.name: left_footprint_frames
properties.description: An array of float. The frames in the running animation (#animations) where the left foot touches the ground.

properties.name: left_footprint_offset
properties.description: Offset from the center of the entity for the left footprint. Used by footprint_particles.

properties.name: mining_categories
properties.description: Names of the resource categories the character can mine resources from.

properties.name: respawn_time
properties.description: Time in seconds. Must be positive

properties.name: right_footprint_frames
properties.description: An array of float. The frames in the running animation (#animations) where the right foot touches the ground.

properties.name: right_footprint_offset
properties.description: Offset from the center of the entity for the right footprint. Used by footprint_particles.

properties.name: synced_footstep_particle_triggers
properties.description: Triggered when the running animation (#animations) rolls over the frames defined in right_footprint_frames and left_footprint_frames.

tables.name: Character
tables.description: Entity that you move around on the screen during the campaign and freeplay.

properties.name: gui_mode
properties.description: Controls which players can control what the chest spawns.

tables.name: InfinityContainer
tables.description: A generic container, such as a chest, that can spawn or void items and interact with the logistics network.

properties.name: shadow_slave_entity
properties.description: Name of an entity.

properties.name: dying_explosion
properties.description: Name of an entity.

tables.name: RocketSiloRocket
tables.description: The rocket inside the rocket silo.

properties.name: bending_type
properties.description: Must be "turn".

tables.name: CurvedRail
tables.description: A curved rail.

tables.name: EntityGhost
tables.description: The entity used for ghosts of entities. In-game, the inner entity (the entity this is a ghost of) is rendered with a ghost_tint.

properties.name: group
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/ItemGroup. The item group this subgroup is located in.

tables.name: ItemSubGroup
tables.description: An item subgroup. The built-in subgroups can be found here. See Prototype/Item#subgroup.

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: The inventory size of the item.

properties.name: extends_inventory_by_default
properties.description: When true, this item-with-inventory will extend the inventory it sits in by default. This is a runtime property on the result item that can be changed through the Lua interface and only determines the initial value.

properties.name: filter_message_key
properties.description: The locale key used when the player attempts to put an item that doesn't match the filter rules into the item-with-inventory.

properties.name: filter_mode
properties.description: This determines how filters are applied. If no filters are defined this is automatically set to "none".

properties.name: insertion_priority_mode
properties.description: The insertion priority mode for this item. This determines if items are first attempted to be put into this items inventory if the item extends the inventory it sits in when items are put into the parent inventory.

properties.name: item_filters
properties.description: A list of explicit item names to be used as filters.

properties.name: item_group_filters
properties.description: A list of explicit item group names to be used as filters.

properties.name: item_subgroup_filters
properties.description: A list of explicit item subgroup names to be used as filters.

tables.name: ItemWithInventory
tables.description: The inventory allows setting player defined filters similar to the quickbar and cargo wagon inventories.

tables.name: ArithmeticCombinator
tables.description: An arithmetic combinator.

properties.name: cliff_explosive
properties.description: Name of a capsule that has a robot_action to explode cliffs.

tables.name: Cliff
tables.description: A cliff.

properties.name: category
properties.description: Optional. The category of this recipe. The built-in categories can be found here. See also Prototype/RecipeCategory.

properties.name: crafting_machine_tint
properties.description: Used by crafting machine working_visualisations to tint certain layers with the recipe color. apply_recipe_tint on the working visualisation determines which of the 4 colors is used for that layer (if any).

properties.name: subgroup
properties.description: The subgroup of this recipe. If not specified, defaults to the subgroup of the product if there is only 1, or main_product if multiple products exist. If multiple products exist and no main_product is specified, the subgroup is required.

tables.name: Recipe
tables.description: A recipe. It can be a crafting recipe, a smelting recipe, or a custom type of recipe (see Prototype/RecipeCategory).

properties.name: scenario
properties.description: Name of the folder for this tutorial in the tutorials folder.

tables.name: Tutorial
tables.description: The definition of the tutorial to be used in the tips and tricks, see Prototype/TipsAndTricksItem. The actual tutorial code is defined in the tutorials folder, in the folder that has the name of the scenario property.

properties.name: mapper_count
properties.description: Can't be > 255.

tables.name: UpgradeItem
tables.description: A upgrade planner.

properties.name: allowed_without_fight
properties.description: If this is set to false, it is not possible to complete the achievement on the peaceful difficulty setting or when the enemy base generation settings have been changed.

properties.name: steam_stats_name
properties.description: Unusable by mods, as this refers to unlocking the achievement through Steam.

tables.name: Achievement
tables.description: This prototype definition is used for the in-game achievements.

properties.name: opened_collision_mask
properties.description: This collision mask is used when the gate is open.

tables.name: Gate
tables.description: A gate.

properties.name: destroy_action
properties.description: Applied when the combat robot expires (runs out of time_to_live).

tables.name: CombatRobot
tables.description: A combat robot. Can attack enemies.

properties.name: default_label_color
properties.description: The default label color the item will use.

properties.name: draw_label_for_cursor_render
properties.description: If the item will draw its label when held in the cursor in place of the item count.

tables.name: ItemWithLabel
tables.description: Like a normal item but with the ability to have a colored label.

tables.name: EquipmentCategory
tables.description: Defines a category to be available to Prototype/Equipment and Prototype/EquipmentGrid. Only 255 instances of this prototype may be defined.

tables.name: TileGhost
tables.description: The entity used for tile ghosts.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the editor-controller. Must be "default" since only one instances of this prototype can be defined.

tables.name: EditorController
tables.description: Properties of the editor controller.

tables.name: ItemRequestProxy
tables.description: Entity used to signify that an entity is requesting items, for example modules for an assembling machine after it was blueprinted with modules inside.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Can't be 0 - the smoke will never render.

properties.name: affected_by_wind
properties.description: Smoke always moves randomly unless movement_slow_down_factor is 0. If affected_by_wind is true, the smoke will also be moved by wind.

properties.name: fade_away_duration
properties.description: fade_in_duration + fade_away_duration must be <= duration.

properties.name: fade_in_duration
properties.description: fade_in_duration + fade_away_duration must be <= duration.

properties.name: movement_slow_down_factor
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1, with 1 being no slowdown and 0 being no movement.

tables.name: TrivialSmoke
tables.description: Smoke, but it's not an entity for optimization purposes. Only 255 instances of this prototype may be defined.

properties.name: fixed_recipe
properties.description: The preset recipe of this machine. This machine does not show a recipe selection if this is set. The base game uses this for the rocket silo.

properties.name: gui_title_key
properties.description: The locale key of the title of the GUI that is shown when the player opens the assembling machine. May not be longer than 200 characters.

properties.name: ingredient_count
properties.description:
Sets the maximum number of ingredients this machine can craft with. Any recipe with more ingredients than this will be unavailable in this machine.

This only counts item ingredients, not fluid ingredients! This means if ingredient count is 2, and the recipe has 2 item ingredients and 1 fluid ingredient, it can still be crafted in the machine.

tables.name: AssemblingMachine
tables.description: An assembling machine - like the assembling machines 1/2/3 in the game, but you can use your own recipe categories.

properties.name: charge_approach_distance
properties.description: Presumably, the distance from the roboport at which robots will wait to charge.

properties.name: construction_radius
properties.description: Can't be negative.

properties.name: recharging_animation
properties.description: The animation played at each charging point when a robot is charging there.

properties.name: spawn_and_station_height
properties.description: Presumably states the height of the charging stations and thus an additive offset for the charging_offsets.

properties.name: burner
properties.description: Must be a burner energy source. Add this is if the roboport should be fueled directly instead of using power from the equipment grid.

properties.name: charging_offsets
properties.description: The offsets from the centre of the roboport at which robots will charge.

properties.name: charging_threshold_distance
properties.description: This defines how far away a robot can be to be charged, however a bot is still required to reach a charging spot and cannot have full battery.

properties.name: power
properties.description: Mandatory if burner is present. The size of the buffer of the burner energy source, so effectively the amount of power that the energy source can produce per tick.

properties.name: recharging_light
properties.description: The light emitted when charging a robot.

properties.name: robot_limit
properties.description: How many robots can exist in the network (cumulative).

properties.name: spawn_minimum
properties.description: Minimum amount of energy that needs to available inside the roboport's buffer so that robots can be spawned.

properties.name: stationing_offset
properties.description: The offset from the centre of the roboport at which robots will enter and exit.

tables.name: RoboportEquipment
tables.description: Used by personal roboport.

properties.name: acceleration
properties.description: Must be != 0 if turning_speed_increases_exponentially_with_projectile_speed is true.

properties.name: action
properties.description: Executed when the projectile hits something.

properties.name: direction_only
properties.description: Setting this to true can be used to disable projectile homing behaviour.

properties.name: final_action
properties.description: Executed when the projectile hits something, after action and only if the entity that was hit was destroyed. The projectile is destroyed right after the final_action.

properties.name: hit_at_collision_position
properties.description: When true the entity is hit at the position on its collision box the projectile first collides with. When false the entity is hit at its own position.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to 0.

properties.name: piercing_damage
properties.description: Whenever an entity is hit by the projectile, this number gets reduced by the health of the entity. If the number is then below 0, the final_action is applied and the projectile destroyed. Otherwise, the projectile simply continues to its destination.

properties.name: rotatable
properties.description: Whether the animation of the projectile is rotated to match the direction of travel.

tables.name: Projectile
tables.description: Entity with limited lifetime that can hit other entities and has triggers when this happens.

properties.name: key_sequence
properties.description:
The default key sequence for this custom input.

    "" (empty string) for unassigned
  • "mouse-button-2" etc for mouse buttons, mouse-button-3 for middle mouse button
  • "mouse-wheel-up", "mouse-wheel-down", "mouse-wheel-left", "mouse-wheel-right" for mouse wheel
  • " + " is used to separate modifier keys from normal keys: "ALT + G"
  • For modifier keys, the following names are used: "CONTROL", "SHIFT", "ALT", "COMMAND"
  • A keybinding can contain an unlimited amount of modifier keys (listed above) but only one normal key (listed below).

properties.name: action
properties.description: A lua event is only raised if the action is "lua".

properties.name: alternative_key_sequence
properties.description: The alternative keybinding for this control. See #key_sequence.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: If this custom input is enabled. Disabled custom inputs exist but are not used by the game. If disabled, no event is raised when the input is used.

properties.name: include_selected_prototype
properties.description: If true, the type and name of the currently selected prototype will be provided as "selected_prototype" in the raised lua event. This also works in GUI's, not just the game world.[2]

properties.name: item_to_spawn
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Item. It will be created when this input is pressed and action is set to "spawn-item". The item must have the "spawnable" flag set.

properties.name: linked_game_control
properties.description: When a custom-input is linked to a game control it won't show up in the control-settings GUI and will fire when the linked control is pressed. [1]

tables.name: CustomInput
tables.description: Used for custom keyboard shortcuts/keybindings in mods. The key associated with the custom input can be changed in the options. This means that key_sequence is simply the default keybinding.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Technically optional, but path to sprite cannot be empty.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the sprite. Must be unique. Can be used as a https://lua-api.factorio.com/latest/Concepts.html#SpritePath.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description: Unused

properties.name: height
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Height of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the sprite.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Sprite definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. Each item (Sprite definition) in the array may also have the layers property.

If this property is present, all other properties are ignored and the mandatory properties do not have to be defined.

Layers may not be an empty table.

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error (Example). If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description: Only loaded if this is an icon (has flag "group=icon" or "group=gui").

properties.name: position
properties.description: Loaded only when x and y are both 0. The first member of the array is x and the second is y.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description: Whether alpha should be premultiplied.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values different than 1 specify the scale of the sprite on default zoom. Scale 2 means that the picture will be 2 times bigger on screen (and more pixelated).

properties.name: shift
properties.description: In tiles. util.by_pixel() can be used to divide the shift by 32 which is the usual pixel height/width of 1 tile in normal resolution. Note that 32 pixel tile height/width is not enforced anywhere - any other tile height or width is also possible.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The width and height of the sprite. If this is an array, the first member of the array is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height.

Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: slice
properties.description:
Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 4×4 grid.

properties.name: slice_x
properties.description: Same as slice above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: slice_y
properties.description: Same as slice above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Width of the picture in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

tables.name: Sprite
tables.description: Specifies a picture that can be used with https://lua-api.factorio.com/latest/Concepts.html#SpritePath during runtime.

properties.name: layer
properties.description: Specifies transition drawing priority.

properties.name: pollution_absorption_per_second
properties.description: Emissions absorbed per second by this tile. Use a negative value if pollution is created instead of removed.

properties.name: variants
properties.description: Graphics for this tile.

properties.name: allowed_neighbors
properties.description: Array of tile names that are allowed next to this one.

properties.name: build_sound
properties.description: If the Sound is provided directly, it is loaded as the "small" build sound.

properties.name: draw_in_water_layer
properties.description: Used only for the layer_group default, see above.

properties.name: minable
properties.description: If you want the tile to not be mineable, don't specify the minable property. Only non-mineable tiles become hidden tiles when placing mineable tiles on top of them.

properties.name: next_direction
properties.description: Name of a tile.

properties.name: transition_merges_with_tile
properties.description: Name of a tile.

properties.name: transitions
properties.description: Extra transitions. Array of TileTransitions. Each TileTransitions needs the extra mandatory property to_tiles, which is a string which is the name of a tile. Furthermore, each TileTransitions needs the extra mandatory property transition_group which is a uint8.

properties.name: transitions_between_transitions
properties.description: Array of TileTransitions. Each TileTransitions needs the extra mandatory properties transition_group1 andtransition_group2 , which are of uint8.

properties.name: trigger_effect
properties.description: Called by InvokeTileEffectTriggerEffectItem.

tables.name: Tile
tables.description: A tile. Only 255 instances of this prototype may be defined.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if the player receives this amount of attacks. Note: The default achievement "it stinks and they dont like it" uses the amount of 1. (As in getting attacked once.)

tables.name: GroupAttackAchievement
tables.description: This prototype definition is used for receiving an achievement when the player gets attacked due to pollution.

properties.name: armor_picture_mapping
properties.description: Table of key value pairs, the keys are armor names and the values are numbers. The number is the Animation that is associated with the armor, e.g. using 1 will associate the armor with the first Animation in the pictures table.

properties.name: picture
properties.description: Either pictures or picture must be defined.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Either pictures or picture must be defined.

tables.name: CharacterCorpse
tables.description: The corpse of a Prototype/Character.

tables.name: SimpleSmoke
tables.description: Deprecated in 0.16. The type "simple-smoke" has been obsoleted and cannot be created. Use Prototype/TrivialSmoke or Prototype/SmokeWithTrigger instead.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This will disable the achievement, if the player crafts more than this.

tables.name: DontCraftManuallyAchievement
tables.description: This prototype definition is used for receiving an achievement when the player finishes the game without crafting more than a set amount.

properties.name: animations
properties.description: Transport belts must have 12 animations. Mandatory if belt_animation_set is not present.

properties.name: belt_animation_set
properties.description:
Either this, or animations has to present.

properties.name: intended_property
properties.description:
Names the property that this expression is intended to provide a value for, if any. This will make the expression show up as an option in the map generator GUI, unless it is the only expression with that intended property, in which case it will be hidden and selected by default.

Note that the "Map type" dropdown in the map generation GUI is actually a selector for "elevation" generators. If generators are available for other properties, the "Map type" dropdown in the GUI will be renamed to "elevation" and shown along with selectors for the other selectable properties.

For example if a noise expression is intended to be used as an alternative temperature generator, intended_property should be "temperature". The base game uses the intended_properties elevation, temperature, moisture and aux. For how the named noise expression with those intended_properties are used in the base game see the notable named noise expression list on Types/NoiseExpression#variable. Mods may add any other intended_property or modify the existing noise expressions to change/remove their intended properties. Furthermore, mods may remove the use of those named noise expressions from the map generation code or change what they affect.

tables.name: NamedNoiseExpression
tables.description:
A NoiseExpression together with a name.

The base game uses named noise expressions to specify functions for many map properties to be used in map generation; e.g. the "elevation" expression is used to calculate elevation for every point on a map. For a list of the built-in named noise expressions, see Data.raw#noise-expression.

Named noise expressions can be used by MapGenSettings and Types/MapGenPreset to override which named expression is used to calculate a given property by having an entry in property_expression_names e.g. elevation = "0.16-elevation".
Alternate expressions can be made available in the map generator GUI by setting their intended_property to the name of the property they should override.
Named noise expressions can also be used by noise variables, e.g. noise.var("my-named-expression").

properties.name: burning_cooldown
properties.description:
Controls for how long the boiler will show the fire and fire_glow after the energy source runs out of energy.

Note that fire and fire_glow alpha is set to the light intensity of the energy source, so 0 light intensity means the fire is invisible. For burner energy sources, the light intensity will reach zero rather quickly after the boiler runs out of fuel, effectively capping the time that fire and fire_glow will be shown after the boiler runs out of fuel.

Examples: Miner does not rotate fluid-resulting resources until depletion. Fluid isn't output (fluid resource change and fluidbox matches previous fluid). properties.name: flow_length_in_ticks
properties.description:
Must be positive.

Used for determining the x position inside the flow_sprite when drawing the storage tank. Does not affect gameplay.

The x position of the sprite will be ((game.tick % flow_length_in_ticks) ÷ flow_length_in_ticks) × (flow_sprite.width - 32). This means, that over flow_length_in_ticks ticks, the part of the flow_sprite that is drawn in-game is incrementally moved from most-left to most-right inside the actual sprite, that part always has a width of 32px. After flow_length_in_ticks, the part of the flow_sprite that is drawn will start from the left again.

properties.description: Must be >= 1.

properties.description: The inner tables have the following key/value pairs. The table with name = default must exist and be the first member of the array.

properties.name: select_group_row_count
properties.description: Must be in range [1, 100].

properties.name: select_slot_row_count
properties.description: Must be in range [1, 100].

properties.name: tooltip_monitor_edge_border
properties.description: Must be >= 1.

properties.name: default_trigger_target_mask_by_type
properties.description: The strings are entity types.

tables.name: UtilityConstants
tables.description: Constants used by the game that are not specific to certain prototypes. See utility-constants.lua for the values used by the base game.

properties.name: rotatable
properties.description: Whether the picture of the projectile is rotated to match the direction of travel.

tables.name: ArtilleryProjectile
tables.description: The projectile shot by artillery.

properties.name: additional_pastable_entities
properties.description:
Names of the entity prototypes this entity prototype can be pasted on to in addition to the standard supported types.
This is used to allow copying between types that aren't compatible on the C++ code side, by allowing mods to receive the on_entity_settings_pasted event for the given entity and do the setting pasting via script.

properties.name: autoplace
properties.description: Used to specify the rules for placing this entity during map generation.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description:
Specification of the entity collision boundaries.

Empty collision box is used for smoke, projectiles, particles, explosions etc.

collision_box = {{-0.4, -0.4}, {0.4, 0.4}}

The {0,0} coordinate in the collision box will match the entity position.

It should be near the center of the collision box, to keep correct entity drawing order. It must include the {0,0} coordinate.

Note, that for buildings, it is customary to leave 0.1 wide border between the edge of the tile and the edge of the building, this lets the player move between the building and electric poles/inserters etc.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: created_effect
properties.description: The effect/trigger that happens when the entity is placed.

properties.name: created_smoke
properties.description: The smoke that is shown when the entity is placed.

properties.name: drawing_box
properties.description:
Specification of space needed to see the whole entity.

This is used to calculate the correct zoom and positioning in the entity info gui.

properties.name: emissions_per_second
properties.description: Amount of emissions created (positive number) or cleaned (negative number) every second by the entity. This is passive, and it is independent concept of the emissions of machines, these are created actively depending on the power consumption. Currently used just for trees.

properties.name: fast_replaceable_group
properties.description:
This allows you to replace an entity that's already placed, with a different one in your inventory. For example, replacing a burner inserter with a fast inserter.

This is simply a string, so any string can be used here. The entity that should be replaced simply has to use the same string here.

properties.name: hit_visualization_box
properties.description: Where beams should hit the entity. Useful if the bounding box only covers part of the entity (e.g. feet of the character) and beams only hitting there would look weird.

properties.name: map_generator_bounding_box
properties.description: Used instead of the collision box during map generation. Allows space entities differently during map generation, for example if the box is bigger, the entities will be placed farther apart.

properties.name: next_upgrade
properties.description:
Name of the entity that will be automatically selected as the upgrade of this entity when using the upgrade planner without configuration.

This entity may not have 'not-upgradable' flag set and must be minable. This entity mining result must not contain item product with "hidden" flag set. Mining results with no item products are allowed. The entity may not be a Prototype/RollingStock.
The upgrade target entity needs to have the same bounding box, collision mask, and fast replaceable group as this entity. The upgrade target entity must have least 1 item that builds it that isn't hidden.

properties.name: placeable_by
properties.description:
Item that when placed creates this entity. Determines which item is picked when "Q" (smart pipette) is used on the entity, determines which item is needed in a blueprint of this entity.

The item count specified here can't be larger than the stack size of that item.

properties.name: remains_when_mined
properties.description: The entity that remains when this one is mined, deconstructed or fast-replaced. The entity wont actually be spawned if it would collide with the entity that is in the process of being mined.

properties.name: remove_decoratives
properties.description: Whether this entity should remove decoratives that collide with it when this entity is built. When set to "automatic", if the entity type is considered a building (e.g. an assembling machine or a wall) it will remove decoratives.

properties.name: selection_box
properties.description:
Specification of the entity selection area. When empty the entity will have no selection area (and thus is not selectable).

The selection box is usually a little bit bigger than the collision box, for tilable entities (like buildings) it should match the tile size of the building.

properties.name: selection_priority
properties.description: The entity with the higher number is selectable before the entity with the lower number.

properties.name: shooting_cursor_size
properties.description: The cursor size used when shooting at this entity.

properties.name: sticker_box
properties.description: Used to set the area of the entity that can have stickers on it, currently only used for units to specify the area where the green slow down stickers can appear. It is optional and the collision box is used when not specified.

properties.name: subgroup
properties.description: The name of the subgroup this entity should be sorted into in the map editor building selection.

properties.name: tile_width
properties.description: Used to determine how the center of the entity should be positioned when building (unless the offgrid flag is specified). When the tile width is odd, the center will be in the center of the tile, when it is even, the center is on the tile transition.

properties.name: vehicle_impact_sound
properties.description: When playing this sound, the volume is scaled by the speed of the vehicle when colliding with this entity.

properties.name: water_reflection
properties.description: May also be defined inside graphics_set instead of directly in the entity prototype. This is useful for entities that use the a graphics_set property to define their graphics, becausen then all graphics can be in defined one place.

properties.name: working_sound
properties.description: Will also work on entities that don't actually do work.

tables.name: Entity
tables.description: Abstract base of all entities in the game. Entity is basically everything that can be on the map (except tiles). For in game script access to entity, take a look at LuaEntity

tables.name: BlueprintItem
tables.description: A blueprint.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if enough entities were deconstructed using construction robots.

tables.name: DeconstructWithRobotsAchievement
tables.description: This prototype definition is used for receiving an achievement when the player deconstructs enough entities with construction robots.

properties.name: walking_sound
properties.description: Sound played when a character walks over this rail.

tables.name: Rail
tables.description: The abstract base of both rail prototypes.

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: Requires animation in attack_parameters. Requires ammo_type in attack_parameters.

properties.name: distance_per_frame
properties.description: How fast the run_animation frames are advanced. The animations are advanced animation_speed frames per distance_per_frame that the unit moves.

properties.name: movement_speed
properties.description: Movement speed of the unit in the world, in tiles per tick. Must be equal to or greater than 0.

properties.name: pollution_to_join_attack
properties.description: The amount of pollution that has to be absorbed by the unit's spawner before the unit will leave the spawner and attack the source of the pollution.

properties.name: vision_distance
properties.description: Note: Setting to 50 or above can lead to undocumented behavior of individual units creating groups on their own when attacking or being attacked.

properties.name: dying_sound
properties.description: The sound file to play when entity dies.

properties.name: has_belt_immunity
properties.description: If the unit is immune to movement by belts.

properties.name: running_sound_animation_positions
properties.description: Ignored if walking_sounds is not defined.

tables.name: Unit
tables.description: Entity that attacks players.

properties.name: ammo_type
properties.description:
When using an array of AmmoType, the AmmoType has an extra property:

  • source_type - AmmoSourceType - Mandatory. - Defines for which kind of entity this ammo type applies. Each entity kind can only be used once per array.

When using a plain AmmoType, the ammo type applies to everything ("default").

properties.name: magazine_size
properties.description: Number of shots before ammo item is consumed. Must be >= 1.

properties.name: reload_time
properties.description: Amount of extra time (in ticks) it takes to reload the weapon after depleting the magazine. Must be >= 0.

tables.name: AmmoItem
tables.description: Ammo used for a gun.

properties.name: ingredients
properties.description:
A table containing ingredient names and counts. Can also contain information about fluid temperature and catalyst amounts. The catalyst amounts are automatically calculated from the recipe, or can be set manually in the IngredientPrototype.[1]
Maximum ingredient amount is 65535.
ingredients can be set to an empty table to create a recipe that needs no ingredients.
Duplicate ingredients, e.g. two entries for the "wood" item, are not allowed.

properties.name: allow_as_intermediate
properties.description: Optional. Whether the recipe can be used as an intermediate recipe in hand-crafting.

properties.name: allow_decomposition
properties.description: Optional. Whether this recipe is allowed to be broken down for the recipe tooltip "Total raw" calculations.

properties.name: allow_inserter_overload
properties.description: If the recipe is allowed to have the extra inserter overload bonus applied (4 * stack inserter stack size).

properties.name: allow_intermediates
properties.description: Optional. Whether the recipe is allowed to use intermediate recipes when hand-crafting.

properties.name: always_show_made_in
properties.description: Optional. Whether the "Made in: {Machine}" part of the tool-tip should always be present, not only when the recipe can not be hand-crafted.

properties.name: always_show_products
properties.description: Optional. Whether the products are always shown in the recipe tool-tip.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description:
Optional. This can be false to disable the recipe at the start of the game, or "true" to leave it enabled.

If your recipe is unlocked by a technology, you should set this to "false".

properties.name: energy_required
properties.description:
Optional. The amount of time it takes to make this recipe.

This is the number of seconds it takes to craft at crafting speed 1.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Optional. Hides the recipe from crafting menus.

properties.name: hide_from_player_crafting
properties.description: Optional. Hides the recipe from the player's crafting screen. The recipe will still show up for selection in machines.

properties.name: hide_from_stats
properties.description: Optional. Hides the recipe from flow stats (item/fluid production statistics).

properties.name: main_product
properties.description:
For recipes with more than one product: This defines of which result the icon, subgroup and name is used. If it is not set and the recipe has more than 1 result the recipe will use the recipe-name and recipe-description locale and its own subgroup and icon.

For recipes with 1 result: The recipe uses the icon, subgroup and name of the result by default. If set this property is set to an empty string, the recipe will use the properties of the recipe instead of the result.

properties.name: overload_multiplier
properties.description:
Used to determine how many extra items are put into an assembling machine before it's considered "full enough". See Inserters#Insertion_limits.

If set to 0, it instead uses the following formula: 1.166 / (energy_required / the assembler's crafting_speed), rounded up, and clamped between 2 and 100. The numbers used in this formula can be changed by the Prototype/UtilityConstants dynamic_recipe_overload_factor, minimum_recipe_overload_multiplier and maximum_recipe_overload_multiplier.

properties.name: result
properties.description: Can be replaced with the results parameter. The item created by this recipe. Must be the name of an item, such as "iron-gear-wheel".

properties.name: result_count
properties.description: Optional. The number of items created by this recipe.

properties.name: results
properties.description:
A table containing result names and counts. Can also contain information about fluid temperature and catalyst amounts. The catalyst amounts are automatically calculated from the recipe, or can be set manually in the ProductPrototype.[2]
results can be set to an empty table to create a recipe that produces nothing.
Duplicate results, e.g. two entries for the "iron-plate" item, are allowed.

properties.name: show_amount_in_title
properties.description: Optional. Whether the recipe name should have the product amount in front of it, e.g. "2 transport belt"

properties.name: unlock_results
properties.description: Optional. Whether enabling this recipe unlocks its item products to show in selection lists (item filter, logistic request etc.).

properties.name: item
properties.description: Name of the Prototype/Item that should be created.

tables.name: WaterReflectionDefinition
tables.description: Entity water reflection.

properties.name: effect
properties.description: Required, read by the game and then immediately discarded. In short: Does nothing.

properties.name: max_temperature
properties.description: max_temperature must be >= default_temperature.

properties.name: min_working_temperature
properties.description: min_working_temperature must be >= default_temperature. min_working_temperature must be <= max_temperature.

properties.name: connections
properties.description: The table may only contain up to 32 connections.

properties.name: explosion
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Explosion.

properties.name: tiles
properties.description: Array of names of Prototype/Tiles. The tiles this footprint particle is shown on when the player walks over them.

properties.name: particle_name
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Particle. The name of the particle that should be created when the character walks on the defined tiles.

properties.name: use_as_default
properties.description: Whether this footprint particle should be the default particle that is used for #tiles that don't have an associated footprint particle.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of a Prototype/Item.
The name of a Prototype/Item.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Mandatory when using numbered keys (an array). If amount is present, amount_min and amount_max are not loaded.
Mandatory when using numbered keys (an array). If amount is present, amount_min and amount_max are not loaded.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1, 0 for 0% chance and 1 for 100% chance.

properties.name: amount_min
properties.description: Mandatory if amount is not specified and named keys are being used.

properties.name: amount_max
properties.description:
Mandatory if amount is not specified and named keys are being used.

If set to a number that is less than amount_min, the game will use amount_min internally.

properties.name: catalyst_amount
properties.description: Amount that should not be affected by productivity modules (not yielded from bonus production) and should not be included in the item production statistics.

tables.name: ItemProductPrototype
tables.description: An item product definition for a Prototype/Recipe. Its loading is triggered by the type of a Types/ProductPrototype being "item". It can be specified as a table with named or numbered keys, but not a mix of both.

properties.name: technology
properties.description:
Read if type is "research-technology".

Name of the technology that triggers this tutorial when it is researched.

properties.name: entity
properties.description:
Read if type is "build-entity".

Name of the entity that triggers this tutorial when it is built.

properties.name: item
properties.description:
Read if type is "craft-item".

Name of the item that triggers this tutorial when it is crafted.

properties.name: count
properties.description:
Read if type is "manual-transfer".

Amount of times manual item transfer has to be done to trigger this tutorial.

properties.name: radius
properties.description: Not including the radius of the unit

properties.name: pipe_connections
properties.description: Max number of members is 255.

properties.name: base_area
properties.description: Must be greater than 0.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Must be greater than 0.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Fluid. Can be used to specify which fluid is allowed to enter this fluid box. [1]

properties.name: pipe_covers
properties.description: The pictures to show when another fluid box connects to this one.

properties.name: minimum_temperature
properties.description: The minimum temperature allowed into the fluidbox. Only applied if a filter is specified [2].

properties.name: maximum_temperature
properties.description: The maximum temperature allowed into the fluidbox. Only applied if a filter is specified [3].

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Set the secondary draw order for all orientations. Used to determine render order for sprites with the same render_layer in the same position. Sprites with a higher secondary_draw_order are drawn on top.

properties.name: secondary_draw_orders
properties.description: Set the secondary draw order for each orientation. Used to determine render order for sprites with the same render_layer in the same position. Sprites with a higher secondary_draw_order are drawn on top.

tables.name: FluidBox
tables.description: Used to set the fluid amount an entity can hold, as well as the connection points for pipes leading into and out of the entity.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/TrivialSmoke

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: Can't be negative, NaN or infinite.

tables.name: SmokeSource
tables.description: Definition of the smoke of an entity.

properties.name: cooldown
properties.description: Number of ticks in which it will be possible to shoot again. If < 1, multiple shots can be performed in one tick.

properties.name: turn_range
properties.description: If this is <= 0, it is set to 1. Arc from 0 to 1, so for example 0.25 is 90°. Used by the flamethrower turret in the base game. Arcs greater than 0.5 but less than 1 will be clamped to 0.5 as targeting in arcs larger than half circle is not implemented.[1]

properties.name: fire_penalty
properties.description: Used when searching for the nearest enemy, when this is > 0, enemies that aren't burning are preferred over burning enemies. Definition of "burning" for this: Entity has sticker attached to it, and the sticker has a spread_fire_entity set.

properties.name: rotate_penalty
properties.description: A higher penalty will discourage turrets from targeting units that would take longer to turn to face.

properties.name: health_penalty
properties.description: A higher penalty will discourage turrets from targeting units with higher health. A negative penalty will encourage turrets to target units with higher health.

properties.name: min_attack_distance
properties.description: If less than range, the entity will choose a random distance between range and min_attack_distance and attack from that distance.

properties.name: ammo_consumption_modifier
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to 0.

properties.name: cooldown_deviation
properties.description: Must be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: warmup
properties.description: Number of ticks it takes for the weapon to actually shoot after the order for shooting has been made. This also allows to "adjust" the shooting animation to the effect of shooting.

properties.name: lead_target_for_projectile_speed
properties.description: Presumably this should be set to the projectile speed to make the unit/turret lead their projectiles.

properties.name: ammo_type
properties.description: Can be mandatory.

properties.name: ammo_categories
properties.description: Names of Prototype/AmmoCategories.

properties.name: ammo_category
properties.description: The name of a Prototype/AmmoCategory. Mandatory if ammo_type and ammo_category is not given, otherwise ignored.

tables.name: BaseAttackParameters
tables.description: The abstract base of all attack parameters.

tables.name: Vector3D
tables.description: table of three floats. Either specified as an array, or with the named keys "x", "y" and "z".

tables.name: TransportBeltConnectorFrame
tables.description: Used to define the graphics for the (in vanilla) yellow frame that is used when a Prototype/TransportBelt is connected to the circuit network.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Rendered in "object" layer, with secondary draw order 0.

properties.name: fluid_animation
properties.description: Rendered in "object" layer, with secondary draw order 20.

properties.name: glass_pictures
properties.description: Rendered in "object" layer, with secondary draw order 40.

properties.name: base_pictures
properties.description: Rendered in layer specified by base_render_layer, with secondary draw order 0.

properties.name: underwater_pictures
properties.description: Drawn by tile renderer when water animation is enabled.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all RotatedAnimation definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. Each item (RotatedAnimation definition) in the array may also have the layers property.

If this property is present, all other properties are ignored and the mandatory properties do not have to be defined.

Layers may not be an empty table.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the RotatedAnimation.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Mandatory if stripes and filenames is not specified.

properties.name: filenames
properties.description: Only loaded if stripes is not present.

properties.name: slice
properties.description: Mandatory if filenames is present.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Mandatory if filenames is present.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
The width and height of the one frame. If this is an array, the first member of the array is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height.

Width and height may only be in the range of 0-8192.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Width of one frame in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Mandatory if size is not given. Height of one frame in pixels, from 0-8192.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the animation in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the animation in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Loaded only when x and y are both 0. The first member of the array is x and the second is y.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values different than 1 specify the scale of the animation on default zoom. Scale 2 means that the picture will be 2 times bigger on screen (and more pixelated).

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description: Only loaded if this is an icon (has flag "group=icon" or "group=gui").

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error (Example). If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description: Whether alpha should be premultiplied.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description: Unused.

properties.name: frame_count
properties.description: Can't be 0.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description: Once the specified number of pictures is loaded, other pictures are loaded on other line. This is to allow having longer animations in matrix, to avoid pictures with too big width. The game engine limits the width of any input picture to 2048px, so it is compatible with most graphics cards.

properties.name: animation_speed
properties.description: Modifier of the animation playing speed, the default is 1, which means one animation frame per tick (60 fps). The speed of playing can often vary depending on the usage (output of steam engine for example). Has to be greater than 0.

properties.name: repeat_count
properties.description: Can't be 0.

properties.name: axially_symmetrical
properties.description: If true, direction_count must be greater than 1.

properties.name: orientation_range
properties.description: Automatically clamped to be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: max_temperature
properties.description: Must be >= default_temperature.

properties.name: min_working_temperature
properties.description: Must be >= default_temperature and <= max_temperature.

properties.name: connections
properties.description: The table may only contain up to 32 connections.

tables.name: HeatBuffer
tables.description: Used to specify heat capacity properties without a heat energy source.

properties.name: default_friendly_color_by_type
properties.description: The strings are entity types.

properties.name: default_color_by_type
properties.description: The strings are entity types.

properties.name: result
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Tile.

properties.name: condition
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Tile.

properties.name: control
properties.description: ID of autoplace control that applies to this entity.

properties.name: default_enabled
properties.description:
Indicates whether the thing should be placed even if MapGenSettings do not provide frequency/size/richness for it (either for the specific prototype of for the control named by AutoplaceSpecification.control).

If true, normal frequency/size/richness (value=1) are used in that case. Otherwise it is treated as if 'none' were selected.

properties.name: force
properties.description: Force of the placed entity. One of "enemy", "player", "neutral", or a custom force name. Only matters for EntityWithForce or EntityWithOwner.

properties.name: order
properties.description: Order for placing the entity (has no effect when placing tiles). Entities whose order compares less are placed earlier (this influences placing multiple entities which collide with itself), from entities with equal order string only one with the highest probability is placed.

properties.name: placement_density
properties.description: For entities and decoratives, how many times to attempt to place on each tile (probability and collisions are taken into account each attempt).

properties.name: tile_restriction
properties.description: For entities and decoratives, how many times to attempt to place on each tile (probability and collisions are taken into account each attempt).

tables.name: AutoplaceSpecification
tables.description:
Autoplace specification is used to determine which entities are placed when generating map. Currently it is used for enemy bases, resources and other entities (trees, fishes, ...).

Autoplace specification describe conditions for placing tiles, entities, and decoratives during surface generation. Probability (of placement on any given tile) and richness (which has different meaning depending on the thing being placed) can be defined either in terms of a set of peaks, or using explicit expressions.

properties.name: idle_animation
properties.description: Idle animation must have the same frame count as animation.

properties.name: always_draw_idle_animation
properties.description: Only loaded if idle_animation is present.

properties.name: shift_animation_waypoints
properties.description: Only loaded if one of shift_animation_waypoint_stop_duration or shift_animation_transition_duration is not 0.

properties.name: shift_animation_waypoint_stop_duration
properties.description: Only loaded if shift_animation_waypoints is present.

properties.name: shift_animation_transition_duration
properties.description: Only loaded if shift_animation_waypoints is present.

properties.name: circuit_connector_layer
properties.description: Renderlayer(s) for all directions of the circuit connectors.

properties.name: circuit_connector_secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Secondary draw order(s) for all directions of the circuit connectors.

properties.name: render_layer
properties.description: Default render layer for the rotations.

tables.name: HeatConnection
tables.description: Defines the connections for a heat energy source in Types/EnergySource.

properties.name: entity_name
properties.description: Name of the entity that should be created.

properties.name: trigger_created_entity
properties.description: If this is true, on_trigger_created_entity is raised when the entity is created.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of a Prototype/Item.
The name of a Prototype/Item.

properties.name: catalyst_amount
properties.description: Only loaded if the table is using named keys. Amount of this ingredient that should not be included in the item consumption statistics. Usually used together with an equal catalyst amount on the "product" of the catalyst in the recipe.

tables.name: ItemIngredientPrototype
tables.description: An item ingredient definition for a Prototype/Recipe. Its loading is triggered by the type of a Types/IngredientPrototype being "item". It can be specified as a table with named or numbered keys, but not a mix of both.

properties.name: apply_module_tint
properties.description: Which tint set in Prototype/Module#beacon_tint should be applied to this, if any.

properties.name: apply_module_tint_to_light
properties.description: Which tint set in Prototype/Module#beacon_tint should be applied to the light, if any.

properties.name: module_visualisations
properties.description: The visualisations available for displaying the modules in the beacon. The visualisation is chosen based on art style, see Types/BeaconModuleVisualizations#art_style and Prototype/Module#art_style.

properties.name: module_tint_mode
properties.description: One of "single-module" or "mix".

properties.name: equipment
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Equipment. Activation is only implemented for Prototype/ActiveDefenseEquipment.

tables.name: ActivateEquipmentCapsuleAction
tables.description: Used by Types/CapsuleAction.

properties.name: direction_count
properties.description: Count of direction (frames) specified.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Either this or "filenames" has to be non-empty.

properties.name: filenames
properties.description: Array of filenames. Either this or "filename" has to be non-empty.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all RotatedSprite definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. Each item (RotatedSprite definition) in the array may also have the layers property.

If this property is present, all other properties are ignored and the mandatory properties do not have to be defined.

Layers may not be an empty table.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the RotatedSprite.

properties.name: hr_version
properties.description: If this property exists and high resolution sprites are turned on, its contents are used to load the RotatedSprite.

properties.name: slice
properties.description:
Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property.

Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 4×4 grid.

An additional item tooltip will be shown for every product, as a separate tooltip, if the item tooltip has a description and/or properties to show and if show_details_in_recipe_tooltip is true.

properties.name: category

properties.name: fade_in_ticks

properties.name: fade_out_ticks
properties.description: Can't be used when match_progress_to_activity is true.

properties.name: idle_sound

properties.name: activate_sound

properties.name: deactivate_sound
